sentences.sContent: He wore his medals with pride.
The people have a sense of pride in their community.
sentences.sCn: 人们对自己的社区有一种自豪感。

sentences.sContent: His heart swelled with pride when his daughter came in.
sentences.sCn: 女儿进来时他的内心充满了自豪感。

sentences.sContent: She felt a glow of pride when her name was announced for the prize.
sentences.sCn: 宣布她获奖时她感到非常自豪。

sentences.sContent: She prides herself on being a good listener.
sentences.sCn: 她为自己善于倾听而感到自豪。

phrases.pCn: 头等重要的位置；首要地位；傲慢
[古语]排场;虚荣[亦作 pride of the world]
处于…的顶峰(或最佳状态)
清晨的薄雾和阵雨(天晴的预兆)

trans.tranOther: a feeling that you are proud of something that you or someone connected with you has achieved
to be especially proud of something that you do well, or of a good quality that you have
